ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to write better academic papers than what I was used to in high school. I gained greater insight about how to structure my essays in the most comprehensible way and how to be more concise.
I learned how to discuss different aspects of celebrity academically, how to write a research paper, and how to implement different writing techniques.
I developed the skills necessary to critically read and discuss nonfiction texts and to write various types of academic papers. This class was a great introduction to college writing.
How to write a research paper

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The strengths are Professor Maggie's teaching style. She was always available to help and made the class very interesting. The weaknesses would be the amount of essays (4) we had to write, but this is standard for all English 114 classes.

A strength of the course is the variety of topics covered in class. Nothing we ever discussed was ever "boring." Our writing also recieved plently of feedback which was helpful for improvement. However, the class was not as focused on how to write as much as I had hoped. We do alot of reading and discussion and not a lot of techqniues for writing. Since this is an into writing course, it would have been benefical if the class was more focused on how to write.
One strength is definitely the professor. Maggie gave thorough feedback on all my work, was extremely understanding and easy to communicate with, and led interesting discussions during class.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I was very engaged with the course, even though it was online. I loved the Daily Dishes that started the class. However, the main problem was the workload. I believe that at least one essay should have been dropped as many students had Zoom fatigue from other classes and we did not have any break days; the workload was not changed to take this into account.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would recommend this course to another student. It is a great introductory course that teaches you how to write academic papers, a skill that everyone should have, regardless of their major.
Yes. Professor Maggie is full of energy and makes each class enjoyable. If you enjoy talking about celebrities, this class is perfect for that.

Yes! This course exposed some crucial weak points in my writing technique. You let your high school or community college writing grades put you in a false sense of comfort and this course will bring you back to reality. Im so glad I took this course. I feel more confident in my abilities to expand on my thoughts. I can ask the right questions and speak clearly to a defined audience. And it was all learned while talking about celebrities!
Yes, especially to students looking to learn how to write academic papers or strengthen their writing. This course taught me writing skills that I will be able to use throughout college.
Yes, its good at teaching students how to write a proper essay.
